qas.question: In what year did Richard Francis Burton break away from the Ethnological Society of London?
What path of exploration did the Anthropological Society of London follow?
Representatives from where were present in the Anthropological Society of London?
Whose work did Hunt stress in the first volume of The Anthropological Review?
Who was influentual among European ethnologists?
Who did Richard Francis Burton break away from in the 18th century?
What society did James Hunt form in the 18th century?
What was the name of Waitz new publication?
What field did Alfred Tylor invent?

context: <b5_0>Waitz<b5_0/> was influential among the <a0_0>British ethnologists<a0_0/>. In <a1_0>1863<a1_0/> the explorer Richard Francis Burton and the speech therapist James Hunt broke away from the <b6_0>Ethnological Society of London<b6_0/> to form the <b7_0>Anthropological Society of London<b7_0/>, which henceforward would follow the path of the new <a2_0>anthropology<a2_0/> rather than just ethnology. It was the 2nd society dedicated to general anthropology in existence. Representatives from the <a3_0>French Société<a3_0/> were present, though not Broca. In his keynote address, printed in the first volume of its new publication, <b8_0>The Anthropological Review<b8_0/>, Hunt stressed the work of <a4_0>Waitz<a4_0/>, adopting his definitions as a standard.[n 5] Among the first associates were the young Edward Burnett Tylor, inventor of <b9_0>cultural anthropology<b9_0/>, and his brother Alfred Tylor, a geologist. Previously Edward had referred to himself as an ethnologist; subsequently, an anthropologist.
